JUNICHI NONAMI
10 Emerson Place #5-D, Boston, MA 02114 USA

Education
1999-2001MIT SLOAN SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT CAMBRIDGE, MA
Candidate for MBA, 2001

Bachelor of Arts in LAW, 1995

Experience
1998-1999THE NOMURA SECURITIES TOKYO, JAPAN
Personnel Department, Headquarters
Organized recruiting seminars for graduating seniors of major  universities. 
Lectured on the nature of the securities  business and the corporate culture at Nomura  to the 
applicants.
Conducted preliminary interviews with job applicants .
Followed the progress of new recruits after they have been assigned to each department.
Developed supplementary on-the-job training programs for the new employee to strengthen their 
skills in consultation with managers.
1995-1998The NOMURA SECURITIES TOKYO, JAPAN
Sales Representative and Financial Consultant  at Akabane branch
Promoted sales of stock, bonds, and investment trusts to about 300 personal customers and 50 
corporate customers.
Aided a plastic company in identifying potential acquisition target.
Advised a food company to take IPO.
Made proposals to improve branch efficiency, especially concerning more effective use of 
computer system.
Scholarship
The Nomura Securities awarded me a scholarship for MBA studies  for the academic years 1999-
2001. I was one of only nine recipients of a scholarship in 1999 out of over 1,000 candidates 
based on an evaluation of my work performance, managerial potential, and English ability.
Personal
Played the bass in the band and released the CD, “Ciao & Adieu”.
Completed Australian continent run by motorcycle for 2 months.
Enjoy playing bass, riding motorcycles, scuba diving, photography, and reading.
